snippet: Because of slowed growth in its once-thriving mobile unit, the electronics giant said its loss for the year would be much larger than it had forecast.
abstract: Sony says it expects to post loss of 230 billion yen, or $2.14 billion, for fiscal year ending in March, almost five times what it previously forecast; says loss was deeper than it had expected because of reduced growth in its once-thriving mobile segment.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Because of slowed growth in its once-thriving mobile unit, the electronics giant said its loss for the year would be much larger than it had forecast.

headline.main: Sony Increases Loss Forecast to $2.14 Billion, as Mobile Growth Slows
headline.print_headline: Sony Increases Loss Forecast to $2.14 Billion, as Mobile Growth Slows
